interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2017/07/16
Average Rating: 4.2
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Stephen Cognetti'], 'Producers': ['Joe Bandelli'], 'Starring': ['Kristin Michelle Taylor', 'Theodore Bouloukos', 'Jeb Kreager'], 'Studio': ['AMC Plus Horror']}
Review Text: Any movie that has be paranoid and turning on lights at night has gotten to me! I totally underestimated this movie, it was pretty good! I love the 'found footage genre', as it adds to the believability and terror of it all. The appeal of the haunted house and trying to figure out what is real and what isn't created the perfect setting for this movie plot. This movie was very scary!  I'm pretty sure I slept with one eye open all night.
Review Title: Surprisingly terrifying!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

Pugh, Desreta Jackson, Danny Glover, Whoopi Goldberg, Leonard Jackson, Akosua Busia, Menno Meyjes, Margaret Avery, Oprah Winfrey, Alice Walker, Adolph CaesarRae Dawn Chong, Steven Spielberg, Bennet Guillory, Dana Ivey, Willard E. Pugh, Desreta Jackson, Danny Glover, Whoopi Goldberg, Leonard Jackson, Akosua Busia, Menno Meyjes, Margaret Avery, Oprah Winfrey, Alice Walker, Adolph Caesar See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Unqualified, French (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround), English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Stereo)', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 34 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.75 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 6.4 Ounces', 'Director': 'Steven Spielberg', 'Media Format': "Multiple Formats, Anamorphic, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, Special Edition, Subtitled, Widescreen, Dubbed, NTSC, Director's Cut", 'Run time': '2 hours and 34 minutes', 'Release date': 'February 18, 2003', 'Actors': 'Danny Glover, Whoopi Goldberg, Oprah Winfrey, Margaret Avery, Willard E. Pugh', 'Dubbed': 'French', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French', 'Studio': 'Warner Home Video', 'Writers': 'Alice Walker, Menno Meyjes', 'Number of discs': '2'} Awesome, classic movie! Thank you! great gift for my mom. Graffiti Bridge Prince (Actor, Director, Writer), Morris Day (Actor) Rated: PG-13 Format: DVD Movies & TV, Music Artists, Prince ['Product Description', 'Graffiti Bridge (DVD)', 'In a sequel of sorts to Purple Rain, the artist formerly known as Princestruggles musically with Morris Day for control of the nightclub thatthe two co-own in this dramatic musical fantasy. There is the power offaith--in oneself and in a higher power. There is the power of love.There is the never-ending struggle between good and bad. And there isthe power of music. Graffiti Bridge.', ']]>', 'Amazon.com', "A sort of fairy-tale sequel to Prince's enormously successful", 'Purple Rain', ", 1990's", 'Graffiti Bridge', "finds his purple highness not only singing and acting, but writing and directing, too. His performance suffers on all fronts. The film isn't a disaster, but it's safe to predict completist fans will make up most of its viewers. In the earlier film, Prince (known as the Kid) was fighting for his place on stage. This time he's fighting to keep his club safe from the money-grubbing hands of his musical rival, the Time's Morris Day, now a nightclub mogul. Day embodies spiritual, sexual, and economic corruption, while the Kid stands for salvation through music and a more redemptive form of lust.", 'The graffiti bridge conceit--a metaphor for a place of rejuvenation and artistic inspiration--is intriguing. Unfortunately, the bridge itself is merely a prop in a Paisley Park soundstage. Where', 'Purple Rain', 'was a movie that set new standards for lensing musical performances,', 'Graffiti Bridge', 'feels like a music video masquerading as a movie. Lucky for us, Prince cast the honey-voiced poet and performer Ingrid Chavez as Aura, part muse and part angel to both Day and the Kid. Her beauty and charisma ignite every frame she graces.', '--Michael Mikesell', 'Set Contains:', 'Bonus features are minimal but apt: a surprisingly good movie trailer and a quartet of relevant music videos, three drawn from the film and one, "Question of U," a characteristically electric concert clip.', '--Michael Mikesell', 'See more'] {'Genre': 'Musicals & Performing Arts/Musicals, Drama', 'Format': 'Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen, Subtitled, Surround Sound', 'Contributor': 'Phillip C, Morris Day, Damon Dickson, Levi Seacer Jr., Kirk Johnson, Ingrid Chavez, Miko Weaver, Prince, Jerome Benton, The Time, Rosie Gaines, Michael Bland, Tony MosleyPhillip C, Morris Day, Damon Dickson, Levi Seacer Jr., Kirk Johnson, Ingrid Chavez, Miko Weaver, Prince, Jerome Benton, The Time, Rosie Gaines, Michael Bland, Tony Mosley See more', 'Language': 'Unqualified, English (Dolby Digital 4.0)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 30 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.75 x 5.75 x 0.5 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Director': 'Prince', 'Media Format': 'Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen, Subtitled, Surround Sound', 'Run time': '1 hour and 30 minutes', 'Release date': 'February 8, 2005', 'Actors': 'Prince, Morris Day, Jerome Benton, Ingrid Chavez, The Time', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish, English, French', 'Studio': 'WarnerBrothers', 'Writers': 'Prince', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} I, along with the rest of the world was devastated when his Royal Purple Badness, Prince Rogers Nelson passed away on 4.21.16 so I wanted to have his movies on dvd ( i had them all on vhs. Haha) and it was just what I needed. This isnt the greatest film but I enjoy it because it's Prince-what can i say?

It was nice to see him reprise his roll as The Kid but it is not as visually appealing and sexy or dramatic as Purple Rain or funny and cinematic as Under the Cherry Moon. Prince can do no wrong. Purple Rain (DVD) Prince (Actor), Apollonia Kotero (Actor), Albert Magnoli (Director, Writer) & 0 more Rated: R Format: DVD Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Drama ['Product Description', 'Purple Rain (DVD)', 'Rock star Prince makes a spectacular feature film debut in this highly autobiographical blockbuster that won both an Oscar and a Grammy award. Headstrong, vulnerable young musician The Kid (Prince) struggles with his own inner demons and with his alcoholic father who beats his mother. But the madness infects his music, fueling a sound that transforms the struggling, young rocker into a star.', ']]>', 'Amazon.com', "When Prince's dazzling and dynamic", 'Purple Rain', '(movie and soundtrack album) and the hypnotic hit single "When Doves Cry" exploded onto the pop-culture scene in 1984, it seemed there was nothing the purple one couldn\'t do. The film is basically a feature-length music video, but no musician has ever had a better big-screen showcase for his many talents. The plot is really just a theme (about the son of an abusive father struggling not to continue the pattern) upon which to hang some of Prince\'s most dazzling songs (including "Let\'s Go Crazy" and the title tune), and some sizzling live-concert numbers. Apollonia Kotero is ravishing as the romantic interest, and Morris Day and the Time provide some terrific musical competition.', 'Purple Rain', "is an essential artifact of the mid-'80s pop Zeitgeist. Prince took home an Oscar for the song score.", '--Jim Emerson'] {'Genre': 'Musicals & Performing Arts/Musicals, Drama', 'Format': 'NTSC, Subtitled', 'Contributor': 'Apollonia Kotero, Steven Fargnoli, Clarence Williams III, Prince, Olga Karlatos, Albert Magnoli, Jerome J. Benton, William Blinn, Morris Day, Joseph Ruffalo, Robert CavalloApollonia Kotero, Steven Fargnoli, Clarence Williams III, Prince, Olga Karlatos, Albert Magnoli, Jerome J. Benton, William Blinn, Morris Day, Joseph Ruffalo, Robert Cavallo See more', 'Language': 'Unqualified, English (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 51 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.38 x 0.6 inches; 1.6 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'MFR085391139829#VG', 'Director': 'Albert Magnoli', 'Media Format': 'NTSC, Subtitled', 'Run time': '1 hour and 51 minutes', 'Release date': 'February 3, 2004', 'Actors': 'Prince, Apollonia Kotero, Morris Day, Olga Karlatos, Clarence Williams III', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Spanish', 'Producers': 'Robert Cavallo, Joseph Ruffalo, Steven Fargnoli', 'Studio': 'WarnerBrothers', 'Writers': 'Albert Magnoli, William Blinn', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Purple Rain is a cult classic and is the best Prince movie. It never gets old and still moves and resonats after all of these years.
The acting was so good that you really believed that this was Prince's biography. Althought it was loosely based on his life, fact or fiction, Purple Rain will always be one of the greatest rock movies ever made. The wardrobe, the cinematography, the music, and the Minneapolis backdrop and culture of that time all created the perfect purple storm of musical genius. Rest in Power Beautiful One! Purple Rain is a cult classic! {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Scott Montoya'], 'Producers': ['Garrett Abdo'], 'Starring': ['Rickey Smiley'], 'Studio': ['Entertainment One']} Funniest stand up EVER! Rickey Smiley is so silly and I love how he laughs at his own jokes! I never tire of watching this special and was glad it was available on Prime. One of my all-time faves! Rickey Smiley is KING! {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'frightening scenes', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Nigel Bach'], 'Producers': ['Nigel Bach'], 'Starring': ['Nigel Bach'], 'Studio': ['Bach Studios']} In the same vein as the docu-horror Blair Witch, Paranormal Activity & other single camera horror movies, this does not disappoint. The home security surveillance cameras with the motion detector sensors were the real stars of the film. It has several "oh sh*t" moments, coupled with the typical "wth is he doing?" Or "just leave the house" moments. This movie is a good watch and creepy. Docu-Horror Realness {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Isaac Rodriguez'], 'Producers': ['Cynthia Bergen'], 'Starring': ['Emanuel Bermudez', 'Billy Necessary'], 'Studio': ['No Sleep']} Ok...it IS my fault that I didnt pay attention to the movie's running time. When i saw the credits, i thought, omg! Did i accidentally skip to the end? Smh. Not sure about the appeal of short films, but I'll pass. Really? {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Stephen Cognetti'], 'Producers': ['Joe Bandelli'], 'Starring': ['Kristin Michelle Taylor', 'Theodore Bouloukos', 'Jeb Kreager'], 'Studio': ['AMC Plus Horror']} Any movie that has be paranoid and turning on lights at night has gotten to me! I totally underestimated this movie, it was pretty good! I love the 'found footage genre', as it adds to the believability and terror of it all. The appeal of the haunted house and trying to figure out what is real and what isn't created the perfect setting for this movie plot. This movie was very scary! I'm pretty sure I slept with one eye open all night. Surprisingly terrifying!
profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Movie Preferences**: The user appreciates classic films with cultural themes and has expanded their interests to include comedic performances and horror, particularly resonating with the suspenseful and immersive elements of the horror genre. Their recent experience with a found footage film highlights a keen enjoyment for narratives that evoke fear and paranoia, despite some skepticism towards shorter film formats. 

- **Genres**: Enjoys musical dramas and films centered on music and performance, embraces comedic specials, and shows a strong affinity for horror documentaries and found footage films that enhance suspense. While maintaining a fondness for foreign films, there's a nuanced engagement with horror that illustrates a confidence in the storytelling of this genre.

- **Key Influencers**: Drawn to impactful works by notable musicians, directors, comedians, and horror filmmakers. The user's affinity for relatable narratives reflects a dual appreciation for both comedic and horror storytelling, indicating a willingness to explore various perspectives.

- **Format**: Prefers films with enhanced viewing experiences, including subtitles, indicating a thoughtful media consumption approach. 

- **Social Connections**: Engages in shared film experiences with family and friends, reinforcing personal relationships through meaningful media exchanges.

- **Rating Behavior**: Values well-crafted storytelling across genres, with recent high ratings for horror reinforcing a strong connection to this genre’s immersive qualities, while ongoing skepticism around shorter formats persists.

- **Overall Engagement**: Engages thoughtfully through reviews, showcasing a passion for classic storytelling, music-driven narratives, and an evolving relationship with horror, maintaining enthusiasm for rich, engaging narratives.
